civs.name: American
civs.ability: Government legacy bonuses accumulate in half the usual number of turns. R&F-Only All Diplomatic policy slots in the current government are converted to Wildcard slots.

unit.name: P-51 Mustang
unit.desc: The P-51 Mustang is a unique air fighter unit of the American civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Fighter.
attributes: Higher Combat Strength (85 vs. 80) and Ranged Strength (85 vs. 80).
May perform Patrols to Intercept incoming enemy aircraft.

infrastructure.name: Film Studio
infrastructure.desc: The Film Studio is a unique building of the American civilization in Civilization VI. It is built in the Theater Square district and replaces the Broadcast Center.
attributes: +100% Tourism pressure from this city towards other civilizations starting from the Modern Era.

leaders.name: Teddy Roosevelt
leaders.ability: Units receive a +5 Combat Strength bonus on their home continent. +1 Appeal to all tiles in a city with a National Park. Gain the Rough Rider unique unit when they research the Rifling technology.

civs.name: Arabian
civs.ability: Automatically receives the final Great Prophet when the next-to-last one is claimed (if they have not earned a Great Prophet already). +1 Science for each foreign city following Arabia's Religion.

unit.name: Mamluk
unit.desc: The Mamluk is a unique heavy cavalry unit of the Arabian civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Knight.
attributes: Heals at the end of every turn, even if it moves or attacks an enemy unit.

infrastructure.name: Madrasa
infrastructure.desc: The Madrasa is a unique building of the Arabian civilization in Civilization VI. It is built in the Campus district and replaces the University.
attributes: Provides bonus Faith equal to the adjacency Science bonus of its district

leaders.name: Saladin
leaders.ability: The Worship building for Arabia's Religion can be purchased by any player at one-tenth of the usual Faith cost. 10% extra Science, Faith, and Culture on Arabian cities with this Worship building.

civs.name: Australian
civs.ability: +3 Housing in coastal cities. Building a Pasture triggers a Culture Bomb, claiming surrounding tiles. Campuses, Commercial Hubs, Holy Sites, and Theater Squares gain +1 to their yields in tiles with Charming Appeal, and +3 with Breathtaking Appeal.

unit.name: Digger
unit.desc: The Digger is a unique melee unit of the Australian civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Infantry.

infrastructure.name: Outback Station
infrastructure.desc: The Outback Station is a unique tile improvement of the Australian civilization in Civilization VI. It cannot be built on Tundra or Snow tiles.
attributes: +1 Production from every adjacent Pasture (with Steam Power)
+1 Production from every 2 adjacent Outback Stations (with Steam Power)
+1 Food from every 2 adjacent Outback Stations (with Rapid Deployment)

leaders.name: John Curtin
leaders.ability: +100% Production if they have either received a declaration of war in the past 10 turns or liberated a city in the past 20 turns.

civs.name: Aztec
civs.ability: Can spend Builder charges to complete 20% of a district's Production cost.

unit.name: Eagle Warrior
unit.desc: The Eagle Warrior is a unique melee unit of the Aztec civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Warrior and is available without any technological research.
attributes: May capture defeated enemies, turning them into Builders for the Aztecs.

infrastructure.name: Tlachtli
infrastructure.desc: The Tlachtli is a unique building of the Aztec civilization in Civilization VI. It is built in the Entertainment Complex district and replaces the Arena.

leaders.name: Monteczuma
leaders.ability: Improved Luxury resources provide an Amenity to 2 extra cities. Military units receive +1 Combat Strength for each different improved Luxury resource in Aztec territory.

civs.name: Brazilian
civs.ability: Rainforest tiles provide a +1 adjacency bonus for Campuses, Commercial Hubs, Holy Sites, and Theater Squares. Tiles in Brazilian territory gain +1 Appeal from adjacent Rainforests, instead of -1.

unit.name: Minas Geraes
unit.desc: The Minas Geraes is a unique naval ranged unit of the Brazilian civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Battleship and is unlocked with Nationalism.
attributes: Higher Combat Strength (70 vs. 60), Ranged Strength (80 vs. 70), and Anti-Air Strength (75 vs. 70).

infrastructure.name: Street Carnival
infrastructure.desc: The Street Carnival is a unique district of the Brazilian civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Entertainment Complex.
attributes: +2 Amenities from entertainment to parent city.
Amenities from the Zoo and Stadium buildings extend to cities whose City Centers are up to 6 tiles away from the district.
Cannot be built if Copacabana has already been built in this city.

leaders.name: Pedro II
leaders.ability: Recruiting or patronizing a Great Person refunds 20% of their point cost.

civs.name: Chinese
civs.ability: Eurekas and Inspirations provide an extra 10% of the cost for researching civics and technologies.

unit.name: Crouching Tiger
unit.desc: The Crouching Tiger is a unique ranged unit of the Chinese civilization in Civilization VI.

infrastructure.name: Great Wall
infrastructure.desc: The Great Wall is a unique tile improvement of the Chinese civilization in Civilization VI. It can only be built in a line on the current border of your territory and cannot be built on top of resources.
attributes: Occupying unit receives +4 Defense Strength and automatically gains 2 turns of fortification.
+1 Gold for each adjacent Great Wall (with Masonry)
+1 Culture for each adjacent Great Wall (with Castles)
Gains bonus Tourism (with Flight) if providing Culture and when worked by a city.

leaders.name: Qin Shi Huang
leaders.ability: Builders receive an additional charge. Can spend Builder charges to complete 15% of the Production cost for Ancient and Classical wonders.

civs.name: Cree
civs.ability: Gains +1 Trade Route capacity and a free Trader upon researching Pottery. Unclaimed tiles within three tiles of a Cree city come under Cree control when a Trader first moves into them.

unit.name: Okihtcitaw
unit.desc: The Okihtcitaw is a unique recon unit of the Cree civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall. It replaces the Scout.

infrastructure.name: Mekewap
infrastructure.desc: The Mekewap is a unique tile improvement of the Cree civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall. It must be built adjacent to a Bonus or Luxury Resource and cannot be adjacent to another Mekewap.
attributes: +1 Gold if adjacent to a Luxury Resource
+1 Food for every two adjacent Bonus Resources
+1 additional Food for every adjacent Bonus Resource (with Conservation)
+1 additional Gold for every two adjacent Luxury Resources (with Cartography)
+1 additional Production and Housing (with Civil Service)

leaders.name: Poundmaker
leaders.ability: All Alliance types provide Shared Visibility. Trade Routes grant +1 Food in the sending city and +1 Gold in the receiving city per Camp or Pasture in the receiving city.

civs.name: Dutch
civs.ability: Rivers provide a +2 adjacency bonus for Campuses, Theater Squares, and Industrial Zones. Building a Harbor triggers a Culture Bomb, claiming surrounding tiles.

unit.name: De Zeven Provinciën
unit.desc: The De Zeven Provinciën is a unique naval ranged unit of the Dutch civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall. It replaces the Frigate.
attributes: Higher Combat Strength (50 vs. 45) and Ranged Strength (60 vs. 55).
Receives a +7 bonus when attacking defensible districts.

infrastructure.name: Polder
infrastructure.desc: The Polder is a unique tile improvement of the Dutch civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall. It must be built on Coast or Lake tiles with at least three adjacent land tiles.
attributes: +2 Food for every adjacent Polder (with Replaceable Parts, replaces earlier +1 bonus)
+1 Production for every adjacent Polder (with Replaceable Parts)
Increases Movement cost of tile to 3.

leaders.name: Wilhelmina
leaders.ability: Your Trade Routes to your own cities provide +1 Loyalty per turn for the starting city. Trade Routes to or from foreign cities provide +1 Culture to you.

civs.name: Egyptian
civs.ability: +15% Production towards districts and wonders built next to a River. Floodplains do not block placement of districts and wonders.

unit.name: Maryannu Chariot Archer
unit.desc: The Maryannu Chariot Archer is a unique ranged unit of the Egyptian civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Heavy Chariot.
attributes: Early ranged unit. Has Range of 2.
Gains +2 movement points if it starts on flat terrain.

infrastructure.name: Sphinx
infrastructure.desc: The Sphinx is a unique tile improvement of the Egyptian civilization in Civilization VI. It can be built on any land terrain (including Hills and Floodplains) and cannot be adjacent to another Sphinx.
attributes: +2 additional Faith if placed next to a Wonder

leaders.name: Cleopatra
leaders.ability: Your Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 Gold for Egypt. Other civilizations' Trade Routes to Egypt provide +2 Food for them and +2 Gold for Egypt. R&F-Only - Earn twice as many Alliance Points from trading with allies.

civs.name: English
civs.ability: Each Archaeological Museum can hold six Artifacts instead of three and can support two Archaeologists at once. Archaeological Museums are automatically themed when they have six Artifacts.

unit.name: Sea Dog
unit.desc: The Sea Dog is a unique naval raider unit of the English civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Privateer.
attributes: Can capture adjacent enemy naval units. (Doesn't work for Barbarian or city-state ships.)
Cannot be seen except by units adjacent to it.

infrastructure.name: Royal Navy Dockyard
infrastructure.desc: The Royal Navy Dockyard is a unique district of the English civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Harbor and must be built on a Coastal tile next to land.
attributes: +1 Movement for all units built in Dockyard.
+2 Gold when built on a foreign continent.
Receives Standard Bonus (+1 Gold) per each adjacent Sea resource; receives Minor Bonus (+0.5 Gold) per each adjacent District.
+1 Trade Route capacity if this city doesn't have a Commercial Hub. (Requires a Lighthouse in Rise and Fall.)
Allows its parent city to build ships, even if the City Center is inland.
Newly built ships will spawn at the Royal Navy Dockyard tile.
Removes movement penalties for units Embarking to and from its tile.
Allows its parent city to build Ships requiring strategic Resources with only 1 count of the relevant resource.
When the Seaport is built, the parent city may construct Fleets and Armadas.
Buildings grant an experience bonus to ships built in this city.
Specialists add +2 Gold and +1 Science each.
R&F-Only +4 Loyalty when built on a foreign continent.

leaders.name: Victoria
leaders.ability: All found or conquered cities on a continent other than your home continent receive a free melee unit. Gain the Redcoat unique unit when the Military Science technology is researched.

civs.name: French
civs.ability: +20% Production towards Medieval, Renaissance, and Industrial era Wonders. Tourism from Wonders of any era is doubled.

unit.name: Garde Imperiale
unit.desc: The Garde Imperiale is a unique melee unit of the French civilization in Civilization VI.
attributes: Receives a bonus for fighting on the starting Capital's home continent.
Earns Great General points from kills.

infrastructure.name: Château
infrastructure.desc: The Château is a unique tile improvement of the French civilization in Civilization VI. It must be built adjacent to a River.
attributes: +2 Culture if adjacent to a Wonder
+1 Gold if adjacent to a luxury resource

leaders.name: Catherine de Medici
leaders.ability: Has 1 level of Diplomatic Visibility greater than normal with every civilization that she's met. Receives a free Spy (and extra spy capacity) with the Castles technology. All spies start as Agents with a free promotion.

civs.name: Georgian
civs.ability: When making a Dedication at the beginning of a Golden Age, receive its Normal Age bonus towards improving Era Score, in addition to its Golden Age bonus.

unit.name: Khevsur
unit.desc: The Khevsur is a unique melee unit of the Georgian civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall.
attributes: +7 Combat Strength and no Movement penalties in Hills.

infrastructure.name: Tsikhe
infrastructure.desc: The Tsikhe is a unique building of the Georgian civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall. It is built in the City Center and replaces the Renaissance Walls.
attributes: Becomes obsolete with Steel, which automatically builds defenses in every city.

leaders.name: Tamar
leaders.abilityName: Glory of the World, Kingdom and Faith
leaders.ability: +100% Faith for 10 turns after declaring a Protectorate War. Each Envoy you send to a city-state of your majority Religion counts as two Envoys. (Must have a majority Religion.)

civs.name: German
civs.ability: Can build one more district than the population limit would normally allow.

unit.name: U-Boat
unit.desc: The U-Boat is a unique naval raider unit of the German civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Submarine.
attributes: Gains +1 Sight and +10 Combat Strength when fighting on Ocean tiles.

infrastructure.name: Hansa
infrastructure.desc: The Hansa is a unique district of the German civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Industrial Zone.
attributes: Unlike the Industrial Zone, the Hansa gets adjacency bonuses from any and all resources (rather than Mines/Quarries).
+2 Production if placed next to a Commercial Hub.
It still receives a Minor bonus (+½) to Production yield for all other adjacent district tiles.
Effect of some Buildings extends to other cities whose City Centers are within 6 tiles of the Zone.

leaders.name: Frederik Barbarossa
leaders.ability: Additional Military policy slot. +7 Combat Strength when attacking city-states.

civs.name: Greek
civs.ability: Receive an extra Wildcard policy slot in any government.

unit.name: Hoplite
unit.desc: The Hoplite is a unique anti-cavalry unit of the Greek civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Spearman.
attributes: Gains +10 Combat Strength when adjacent to at least one Hoplite unit.

infrastructure.name: Acropolis
infrastructure.desc: The Acropolis is a unique district of the Greek civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Theater Square and can only be built on Hills.
attributes: Receives a Standard bonus (+1) to Culture yield for each adjacent Wonder and for each adjacent district tile. Also receives a Major (+2) Bonus when adjacent to the City Center
+1 Great Writer, Great Artist and Great Musician points per turn
Buildings have slots for Great Works and Artifacts

leaders.name: Pericles
leaders.ability: +5% Culture per city-state you are the Suzerain of.

leaders.name: Gorgo
leaders.ability: Combat victories provide Culture equal to 50% of the Combat Strength of the defeated unit.

civs.name: Indian
civs.ability: Receive the benefits of all Follower beliefs of Religions present in your cities, not just the one you founded.

unit.name: Varu
unit.desc: The Varu is a unique heavy cavalry unit of the Indian civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Horseman.
attributes: Reduces the Combat Strength of adjacent enemy units by 5, with the penalties being cumulative for enemies adjacent to multiple Varu.

infrastructure.name: Stepwell
infrastructure.desc: The Stepwell is a unique tile improvement of the Indian civilization in Civilization VI. It cannot be built on Hills or adjacent to another Stepwell.
attributes: +1 additional Food if placed adjacent to a Farm
+1 additional Faith if placed adjacent to a Holy Site

leaders.name: Gandhi
leaders.ability: +5 Faith for each civilization (including India) they have met that has founded a Religion and is not currently at war. Opposing civilizations receive double the war weariness for fighting against Gandhi.

leaders.name: Chandragupta
leaders.ability: Receive the benefits of all Follower beliefs of Religions present in your cities, not just the one you founded.

civs.name: Indonesian
civs.ability: Coast and Lake tiles provide a minor adjacency bonus for Holy Site, Campus, Industrial Zone, and Theater Square districts. +1 Amenity from entertainment to each Entertainment Complex adjacent to a Coast or Lake tile.

unit.name: Jong
unit.desc: The Jong is a unique naval ranged unit of the Indonesian civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Frigate and is unlocked with Mercenaries.
attributes: When in formation, +5 Combat Strength and shares its Movement with all units in the formation.

infrastructure.name: Kampung
infrastructure.desc: The Kampung is a unique tile improvement of the Indonesian civilization in Civilization VI. It must be built on Coast or Lake tiles adjacent to sea resources but cannot be built on reefs.
attributes: +1 Food from every adjacent Fishing Boats
+1 Tourism from every bonus Food (with Flight)

leaders.name: Gitarja
leaders.abilityName: Exalted Goddess of the Three Worlds
leaders.ability: Naval units can be purchased with Faith. Religious units pay no movement to embark or disembark. +2 Faith to City Centers that are adjacent to Coast or Lake tiles.

civs.name: Japanese
civs.ability: All districts receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district.

unit.name: Samurai
unit.desc: The Samurai is a unique melee unit of the Japanese civilization in Civilization VI.
attributes: Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.

infrastructure.name: Electronics Factory
infrastructure.desc: The Electronics Factory is a unique building of the Japanese civilization in Civilization VI. It is built in the Industrial Zone district and replaces the Factory.
attributes: +4 Production to all City Centers within 6 tiles of the Electronics Factory's Industrial Zone.

leaders.name: Hojo Tokimune
leaders.ability: Land units receive +5 Combat Strength in land tiles adjacent to Coast; naval units receive +5 Combat Strength in shallow water tiles. Build Encampment, Holy Site and Theater Square districts in half the time.

civs.name: Khmer
civs.ability: +3 Faith and +1 Amenity from entertainment to each city with an Aqueduct. Farms provide +2 Food if adjacent to an Aqueduct.

unit.name: Domrey
unit.desc: The Domrey is a unique siege unit of the Khmer civilization in Civilization VI.
attributes: Deals bombard-type damage, effective against district defenses.
Can move and attack on the same turn.

infrastructure.name: Prasat
infrastructure.desc: The Prasat is a unique building of the Khmer civilization in Civilization VI. It is built in the Holy Site district and replaces the Temple.
attributes: Allows purchasing of Apostles and Inquisitors in this city.
Missionaries purchased in this city receive the Martyr promotion.

leaders.name: Jayavarman VII
leaders.ability: Holy Sites provide +2 Food and +1 Housing if placed on a river. Holy Sites trigger a culture bomb.

civs.name: Kongolese
civs.ability: +2 Food, +2 Production, and +4 Gold from each Relic, Artifact, and Sculpture Great Work of Art in addition to the usual Culture. Receive 50% more Great Writer, Great Artist, Great Musician, and Great Merchant points. Palace has slots for 5 Great Works.

unit.name: Ngao Mbeba
unit.desc: The Ngao Mbeba is a unique melee unit of the Kongolese civilization. It replaces the Swordsman.
attributes: Does not suffer movement or sight penalties in Woods or Rainforests.
Gains a defensive bonus against ranged attacks.
Does not require Iron to build.

infrastructure.name: Mbanza
infrastructure.desc: The Mbanza is a unique district of the Kongolese civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Neighborhood and must be built on Woods or Rainforest tiles.
attributes: Available earlier (with Guilds rather than Urbanization)
Yield does not change based on the tile's Appeal

leaders.name: Mvemba a Nzinga
leaders.ability: May not build Holy Site Districts, gain Great Prophets, or found Religions. Gains all Beliefs of any Religion that has established itself in a majority of his cities. Receives an Apostle each time he finishes a M'banza or Theater Square (of that city's majority Religion).

civs.name: Korean
civs.ability: Mines receive +1 Science if there is an adjacent Seowon district. Farms receive bonus Food if there is an adjacent Seowon district.

unit.name: Hwacha
unit.desc: The Hwacha is a unique ranged unit of the Korean civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall. It replaces the Field Cannon and is unlocked with Gunpowder.
attributes: Cannot move and attack in the same turn.

infrastructure.name: Seowon
infrastructure.desc: The Seowon is a unique district of the Korean civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall. It replaces the Campus and must be built on hills.
attributes: -1 penalty to Science for each adjacent district tile.

leaders.name: Seondeok
leaders.ability: +10% Culture and +10% Science in all cities with an established Governor.

civs.name: Macedonian
civs.ability: Receive boosts upon city conquest: a Eureka for each Encampment or Campus in the conquered city and an Inspiration for each Holy Site or Theater Square.

unit.name: Hypaspist
unit.desc: The Hypaspist is a unique melee unit of the Macedonian civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Swordsman.
attributes: +5 Combat Strength when besieging a district.

infrastructure.name: Basilikoi Paides
infrastructure.desc: The Basilikoi Paides is a unique building of the Macedonian civilization in Civilization VI. It is built in the Encampment district and replaces the Barracks.
attributes: +25% combat experience for all melee, ranged land units, and Hetairoi trained in this city.
Gain Science equal to 25% of the unit's cost when a non-civilian unit is created in this city.
Cannot be built in an Encampment district that already has a Stable.

leaders.name: Alexander
leaders.ability: Cities do not incur war weariness. All military units heal completely when this player captures a city with a world wonder. (Hidden: Allows access to the Hetairoi unique unit.)

civs.name: Mapuche
civs.ability: All units trained in cities with an established Governor gain 25% more experience in combat. +10 Combat Strength bonus against civilizations that are in a Golden Age.

unit.name: Malón Raider
unit.desc: The Malón Raider is a unique light cavalry unit of the Mapuche civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall.
attributes: +5 Combat Strength within 4 tiles of friendly territory.

infrastructure.name: Chemamull
infrastructure.desc: The Chemamull is a unique tile improvement of the Mapuche civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall. It must be built on a tile with an Appeal of Breathtaking (4 or more).
attributes: Provides Culture equal to 75% of its tile's Appeal.

leaders.name: Lautaro
leaders.ability: If a Mapuche unit defeats an enemy unit within the borders of the enemy city, that city loses 20 Loyalty.

civs.name: Mongolian
civs.ability: Starting a Trade Route immediately creates a Trading Post in the destination city. Receive an extra level of Diplomatic Visibility for possessing a Trading Post in any city of a civilization. All Mongolian units gain +3 Combat Strength for each level of Diplomatic Visibility on their opponent.

unit.name: Keshig
unit.desc: The Keshig is a unique ranged cavalry unit of the Mongolian civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall.
attributes: When in formation, shares its Movement with all units in the formation.

infrastructure.name: Ordu
infrastructure.desc: The Ordu is a unique building of the Mongolian civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall. It is built in the Encampment district and replaces the Stable.
attributes: +25% combat experience for all light and heavy cavalry units trained in this city
+1 Movement for all light and heavy cavalry units trained in this city
Cannot be built in an Encampment district that already has a Barracks.

leaders.name: Genghis Khan
leaders.ability: All cavalry class units gain +3 Combat Strength and a chance to capture defeated enemy cavalry class units.

civs.name: Norwegian
civs.ability: Norwegian units gain the ability to enter ocean tiles after researching Shipbuilding. Naval melee units heal in neutral territory. Units ignore additional Movement costs from embarking and disembarking.

unit.name: Berserker
unit.desc: The Berserker is a unique melee unit of the Norwegian civilization in Civilization VI.
attributes: Uses one less movement to pillage tiles.
Has 4 Movement if this unit starts in enemy territory.
+7 Combat Strength when attacking and -7 Combat Strength when defending.

infrastructure.name: Stave Church
infrastructure.desc: The Stave Church is a unique building of the Norwegian civilization in Civilization VI. It is built in the Holy Site district and replaces the Temple.
attributes: Holy Site gets an additional Standard Adjacency bonus (+1) from Woods.
+1 Production for every coastal resource worked by the city

leaders.name: Harald Hardrada
leaders.ability: Allows coastal raiding for all naval melee units and +50% Production toward all naval melee units. (Hidden: Allows access to the Viking Longship unique unit.)

civs.name: Nubian
civs.ability: +50% Production toward Ranged units. All Ranged units gain +50% combat experience. Mines over strategic resources provide +1 Production. Mines over bonus and luxury resources provide +2 Gold.

unit.name: Pítati Archer
unit.desc: The Pítati Archer is a unique ranged unit of the Nubian civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Archer.

infrastructure.name: Nubian Pyramid
infrastructure.desc: The Nubian Pyramid is a unique tile improvement of the Nubian civilization in Civilization VI. It must be built on Desert (including Hills) or Floodplains tiles.
attributes: +1 Food if adjacent to a City Center
+1 Science if adjacent to a Campus
+1 Gold if adjacent to a Commercial Hub
+1 Gold if adjacent to a Harbor
+1 Faith if adjacent to a Holy Site
+1 Production if adjacent to an Industrial Zone
+1 Culture if adjacent to a Theater Square

leaders.name: Amanitore
leaders.ability: +20% Production on all districts rising to +40% if the city contains a Nubian Pyramid adjacent to the City Center.

civs.name: Persian
civs.ability: +1 Trade Route capacity with Political Philosophy civic. Receive +2 Gold and +1 Culture for routes between your own cities. Roads built in your territory are one level more advanced than usual.

unit.name: Immortal
unit.desc: The Immortal is a unique melee unit of the Persian civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Swordsman.
attributes: Has a ranged attack (25 Ranged Strength, 2 Range).

infrastructure.name: Pairidaeza
infrastructure.desc: The Pairidaeza is a unique tile improvement of the Persian civilization in Civilization VI. It cannot be built on Tundra or Snow tiles, or adjacent to another Pairidaeza.
attributes: +1 Culture for every adjacent Holy Site and Theater Square
+1 Gold for every adjacent Commercial Hub and City Center

leaders.name: Cyrus
leaders.ability: +2 Movement for the first 10 turns after declaring a Surprise War. No penalties to yields in occupied cities. Declaring a Surprise War only counts as a Formal War for the purpose of warmongering and war weariness.

civs.name: Polish
civs.ability: Building an Encampment district or Fort in friendly territory claims all surrounding tiles, even from foreign cities. One military policy slot is turned into a wildcard slot.

unit.name: Winged Hussar
unit.desc: The Winged Hussar is a unique heavy cavalry unit of the Polish civilization in Civilization VI. It is unlocked through the Mercenaries civic.
attributes: Pushes back enemies if it does more damage than it takes when attacking. Defenders that cannot be pushed back take additional damage.

infrastructure.name: Sukiennice
infrastructure.desc: The Sukiennice is a unique building of the Polish civilization in Civilization VI. It is built in the Commercial Hub district and replaces the Market.

leaders.name: Jadwiga
leaders.ability: Claiming territory off another city via Poland's Civ Ability converts it to your religion. Relics provide +4 Gold, +2 Culture and +2 Faith. Holy Sites have increased adjacency bonuses.

civs.name: Roman
civs.ability: All cities start with a Trading Post, and new cities in Trade Route range of your Capital will automatically have a road going to them. Trade Routes going through your cities earn extra Gold.

unit.name: Legion
unit.desc: The Legion is a unique melee unit of the Roman civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Swordsman.
attributes: Can construct a Roman Fort, available earlier than Forts built by Military Engineers, or clear terrain. A Legion has only one build charge, and loses this ability upon upgrade to Musketman.

infrastructure.name: Bath
infrastructure.desc: The Bath is a unique district of the Roman civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Aqueduct district and must be built adjacent to both the City Center and a River, Lake, Oasis, or Mountain.
attributes: Provides the city with a source of fresh water from an adjacent River, Lake, Oasis, or Mountain.
Cities that do not yet have existing fresh water receive up to 6 Housing.
Cities that already have existing fresh water will instead get +2 Housing.
Provides an additional bonus of +2 Housing and +1 Amenity in either case.

leaders.name: Trajan
leaders.ability: All cities start with an additional City Center building. (Starts with a Monument building in the Ancient era.)

civs.name: Russian
civs.ability: Gain extra territory when they found their cities, and extra Faith and Production from tundra tiles.

unit.name: Cossack
unit.desc: The Cossack is a unique light cavalry unit of the Russian civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Cavalry.
attributes: +5 Combat Strength when fighting in or next to home territory.

infrastructure.name: Lavra
infrastructure.desc: The Lavra is a unique district of the Russian civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Holy Site.
attributes: It generates an additional +1 Great Prophet point per turn (for a total of +2 Great Prophet points per turn).
It also provides +1 Great Writer point, +1 Great Artist point, and +1 Great Musician point per turn. These three aren't improved by the Oracle.
It expands the city's borders whenever a Great Person is used in the city.

Receives Major bonus (+2) to Faith yield for each adjacent Natural Wonder, a Standard bonus (+1) to Faith yield for each adjacent Mountain tile, and Minor bonus (+½) to Faith for each adjacent district tile and each adjacent unimproved Woods tile.
A religion can be founded in a Lavra.
Religious units can be purchased in a city with a Lavra, spawning in the Lavra or if that's unavailable in the City Center (stacking limits permitting).
Religious units heal in a Lavra and in tiles adjacent to it.

leaders.name: Peter
leaders.ability: Receives Science or Culture from Trade Routes to civilizations that are more advanced than Russia (+1 per 3 technologies or civics ahead).

civs.name: Scottish
civs.ability: Happy cities receive an additional +5% Science and +5% Production. Happy cities generate +1 Great Scientist point per Campus and +1 Great Engineer point per Industrial Zone. Ecstatic cities double all these amounts.

unit.name: Highlander
unit.desc: The Highlander is a unique recon unit of the Scottish civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall. It replaces the Ranger.
attributes: Higher Strength (50 vs. 45) and Ranged Strength (65 vs. 60).
+5 Combat Strength in Hills and Woods.

infrastructure.name: Golf Course
infrastructure.desc: The Golf Course is a unique tile improvement of the Scottish civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall. It cannot be placed on Desert or Desert Hills tiles, and there is a limit of one Golf Course per city.
attributes: +1 Culture if adjacent to a City Center
+1 Culture if adjacent to an Entertainment Complex
Tiles with Golf Courses cannot be swapped.

leaders.name: Robert the Bruce
leaders.ability: Can declare a War of Liberation after gaining the Defensive Tactics Civic, instead of the Diplomatic Service Civic. +100% Production and +2 Movement for the first 10 turns after declaring a War of Liberation.

civs.name: Scythian
civs.ability: Receive a second light cavalry unit or Saka Horse Archer each time you train a light cavalry unit or Saka Horse Archer.

unit.name: Saka Horse Archer
unit.desc: The Saka Horse Archer is a unique ranged unit of the Scythian civilization in Civilization VI.
attributes: Does not require Horses to build.
Upgrades to Field Cannon instead of Crossbowman.

infrastructure.name: Kurgan
infrastructure.desc: The Kurgan is a unique tile improvement of the Scythian civilization in Civilization VI. It cannot be built on Hills.

leaders.name: Tomyris
leaders.ability: All units receive +5 Combat Strength when attacking wounded units. When they eliminate a unit, they heal up to 30 hit points.

civs.name: Spanish
civs.ability: May form Fleets and Armadas earlier than usual (Mercantilism). Trade Routes between multiple continents receive bonus Gold for routes to other civilizations, and bonus Food and Production for routes between your own cities.

unit.name: Conquistador
unit.desc: The Conquistador is a unique melee unit of the Spanish civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Musketman.
attributes: +10 Combat Strength when escorting (or when in the same tile with) a religious unit.
Converts cities to Spain's religion (if they have founded one) if it captures a city or is adjacent to the city when it is captured.

infrastructure.name: Mission
infrastructure.desc: The Mission is a unique tile improvement of the Spanish civilization in Civilization VI.
attributes: +2 Faith if on a different continent than your Capital
+2 Science if built next to a Campus district

leaders.name: Philip II
leaders.ability: Inquisitors can Remove Heresy one extra time. Combat units have a bonus of +4 Combat Strength against players following other Religions.

civs.name: Sumerian
civs.ability: Every time you capture a barbarian outpost, you also get a tribal village reward. Pay in half the usual cost to levy city-state units.

unit.name: War-Cart
unit.desc: The War-Cart is a unique heavy cavalry unit of the Sumerian civilization in Civilization VI. It is available without any technological research.
attributes: Strongest of the starting units in the game.
No combat penalties against anti-cavalry units.
+1 Movement if starting in open terrain.

infrastructure.name: Ziggurat
infrastructure.desc: The Ziggurat is a unique tile improvement of the Sumerian civilization in Civilization VI. It cannot be built on Hills.
attributes: +1 Culture if placed adjacent to a river

leaders.name: Gilgamesh
leaders.ability: May declare war on anyone at war with their allies without warmonger penalties. When at war with a common foe, they and their allies share pillage rewards and share combat experience gains if within 5 tiles. R&F-Only - Their Alliances gain Alliance Points for being at war with a common foe.

civs.name: Zulu
civs.ability: Cities with a garrisoned unit get +3 Loyalty per turn, or +5 if it is a Corps or Army. Conquering a city with a unit will upgrade it into a Corps or Army, if the proper Civics are unlocked.

unit.name: Impi
unit.desc: The Impi is a unique anti-cavalry unit of the Zulu civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall. It replaces the Pikeman.

infrastructure.name: Ikanda
infrastructure.desc: The Ikanda is a unique district of the Zulu civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall. It replaces the Encampment.
attributes: Acquires Walls and Ranged Strike along with the City Center.
Spawns all Land Military Units the city builds.
Gives its parent city the ability to build Land Units with only 1 count of the relative Strategic resource
Provides XP bonus to units built in it once Buildings have been added to the District
Specialists provide +1 Production and Culture each
25% faster training of Corps and Armies
Allows Corps and Armies to be built outright

leaders.name: Shaka
leaders.ability: May form Corps (Mercenaries Civic) and Armies (Nationalism Civic) earlier. An additional +5 Base Combat Strength to both Corps and Armies.

civs.name: Canadian
civs.ability: Cannot declare war on City-States or surprise wars. Surprise wars cannot be declared on Canada. For every 100 Tourism earn 1 Diplomatic Favor. Receive +100% Diplomatic Favor from successfully completing an Emergency or Scored Competition.

unit.name: Mountie
unit.desc: The Mountie is a unique light cavalry unit of the Canadian civilization in Civilization VI: Gathering Storm.
attributes: +5 Combat Strength when within 2 tiles of a National Park. +5 additional Combat Strength if the park is Canadian.
Has one build charge. (Lost upon upgrade.)
Can establish a National Park. (Consumes build charge.)

infrastructure.name: Ice Hockey Rink
infrastructure.desc: The Ice Hockey Rink is a unique tile improvement of the Canadian civilization in Civilization VI: Gathering Storm. It must be built on Tundra, Tundra Hills, Snow, or Snow Hills tiles.
attributes: +1 Culture for each adjacent Tundra, Tundra Hills, Snow, and Snow Hills tile
+4 Culture if adjacent to a Stadium

leaders.name: Wilfrid Laurier
leaders.ability: Allows Farms to be built on Tundra terrain. After Civil Engineering is unlocked Farms can be built on Tundra Hills. Reduces the cost of purchasing Snow, Snow Hills, Tundra Hills, and Tundra tiles by 50%. +100% extraction rate of accumulated resources on Snow, Snow Hills, Tundra Hills, and Tundra tiles.

civs.name: Māori
civs.ability: Starts the game with Sailing and Shipbuilding unlocked and the ability to enter Ocean tiles. Embarked units gain +5 Combat Strength and +2 Movement. Unimproved Woods and Rainforest provide +1 Production, increased to +2 with Conservation. Fishing Boats provide +1 Food. Building a Fishing Boat triggers a Culture Bomb, claiming surrounding tiles. Resources cannot be harvested. Great Writers cannot be earned.

unit.name: Toa
unit.desc: The Toa is a unique melee unit of the Māori civilization in Civilization VI: Gathering Storm.
attributes: Reduces the Combat Strength of adjacent enemy units by 5.
Has one build charge. (Lost upon upgrade.)
Can construct a Pā. (Consumes build charge.)

infrastructure.name: Marae
infrastructure.desc: The Marae is a unique building of the Māori civilization in Civilization VI: Gathering Storm. It is built in the Theater Square district and replaces the Amphitheater.
attributes: +2 Culture and Faith to all of this city's tiles with a passable feature.
+2 Tourism to all of this city's tiles with a feature (with Flight).

leaders.name: Kupe
leaders.ability: Starts the game in the Ocean. +2 Science and +2 Culture per turn before the first city is settled. Their first settled city receives a free Builder and +1 Population. The Palace grants +3 Housing and +1 Amenity.

civs.name: Hungarian
civs.ability: +50% Civ6Production Production for districts and buildings built across a river from a City Center.

unit.name: Huszár
unit.desc: The Huszár is a unique light cavalry unit of the Hungarian civilization in Civilization VI: Gathering Storm. It replaces the Cavalry.
attributes: +3 Combat Strength for every active Alliance.

infrastructure.name: Thermal Bath
infrastructure.desc: The Thermal Bath is a unique building of the Hungarian civilization in Civilization VI: Gathering Storm. It is built in the Entertainment Complex district and replaces the Zoo.
attributes: +2 Amenities from entertainment. This bonus extends to each City Center within 6 tiles.
+2 Production. This bonus extends to each City Center within 6 tiles.
+3 Tourism and +2 additional Amenities to this city if there is at least one Geothermal Fissure within its borders.

leaders.name: Matthias Corvinus
leaders.ability: Levied city-state units receive +2 Civ6Movement Movement and +5 Civ6StrengthIcon Combat Strength, and can be upgraded at no cost in Civ6Gold Gold or resources. Levying troops from a city-state grants 2 Envoy6 Envoys with that city-state. Gain the Black Army unique unit with Castles.

civs.name: Incan
civs.ability: Citizens may work Mountain tiles. Mountain tiles provide +2 Production. +1 Food to Mountain tiles for every adjacent Terrace Farm.

unit.name: Warak'aq
unit.desc: The Warak'aq a unique recon unit of the Incan civilization in Civilization VI: Rise and Fall. It replaces the Skirmisher.
attributes: May make 1 additional attack per turn.

infrastructure.name: Terrace Farm
infrastructure.desc: The Terrace Farm is a unique tile improvement of the Incan civilization in Civilization VI: Gathering Storm. It must be built on Grassland Hills, Plains Hills, or Desert Hills tiles.
attributes: +1 Production if adjacent to fresh water and not an Aqueduct

leaders.name: Pachacuti
leaders.ability: Domestic Trade Routes gain +1 Food for every Mountain tile in the origin city. Gain the Qhapaq Ñan improvement when Foreign Trade civic is discovered.

civs.name: Mali
civs.ability: City Centers gain +1 Faith and +1 Food for every adjacent Desert and Desert Hills tile. Mines receive -1 Production and +4 Gold. May purchase Commercial Hub buildings with Faith. -30% Production towards buildings and units.

unit.name: Mandekalu Cavalry
unit.desc: Mali unique Medieval Era unit that replaces the Knight.
attributes: Trader units are immune to being plundered within 4 tiles of a Mandekalu Cavalry and on a land tile.
Combat victories provide Gold equal to 100% that unit's base Combat Strength.

infrastructure.name: Suguba
infrastructure.desc: A district unique to Mali specializing in finance and trade that replaces the Commercial Hub.
attributes: Units, Buildings, and Districts are 20% cheaper to purchase with Gold and Faith in this city.
+2 Gold Adjacency bonus for each adjacent holy site.
+2 Gold Adjacency bonus for being next to a river.
+1 Gold Adjacency for every 2 adjacent district tiles.

leaders.name: Mansa Musa
leaders.ability: International Trade Routes gain +1 Gold for every flat Desert tile in the sending city. Entering a Golden Age permanently grants +1 Trade Route capacity.

civs.name: Phoenician
civs.ability: Starts with the Eureka for Writing. Coastal cities founded by Phoenicia and in the same continent as their Capital always have full Loyalty. Settlers receive +2 Movement and sight radius while embarked, and pay no Movement costs to embark or disembark.

unit.name: Bireme
unit.desc: The Bireme is a unique naval melee unit of the Phoenician civilization in Civilization VI: Gathering Storm. It replaces the Galley
attributes: Prevents friendly Traders within 4 tiles from being plundered as long as they are on a water tile.

infrastructure.name: Cothon
infrastructure.desc: The Cothon is a unique district of the Phoenician civilization in Civilization VI: Gathering Storm. It replaces the Harbor and must be built on a Coast or Lake tile next to land.
attributes: +50% Production towards naval units and Settlers in this city.
All wounded naval units in the city's borders heal +100 HP each turn.
Allows for sea lane Trade Route (even if the district is still under construction).

leaders.name: Dido
leaders.ability: Cities with a Cothon gain the unique Move Capital project, which moves the Phoenician capital to that city. Gains +1 Trade Route capacity after building the Government Plaza or any Government Plaza building. +50% Production towards districts in the city with the Government Plaza.

civs.name: Ottoman
civs.ability: +50% Production toward Siege units. Siege units gain +5 Combat Strength when attacking defensible districts. Conquering a city doesn't cause that city to lose Population. +1 Amenity and +4 Loyalty per turn for cities not founded by the Ottomans.

unit.name: Barbary Corsair
unit.desc: The Barbary Corsair is a unique naval raider unit of the Ottoman civilization in Civilization VI: Gathering Storm. It replaces the Privateer and is unlocked at Medieval Faires.
attributes: Invisible except to City Centers, Encampments, Destroyers, and units in an adjacent tile.
Uses no Movement to perform coastal raids.

infrastructure.name: Grand Bazaar
infrastructure.desc: The Grand Bazaar is a unique building of the Ottoman civilization in Civilization VI: Gathering Storm. It is built in the Commercial Hub district and replaces the Bank.
attributes: Accumulate one extra Strategic resource for every different type of Strategic resources this city has improved.
Receive 1 Amenity for every Luxury resource this city has improved.

leaders.name: Suleiman
leaders.ability: Has access to a unique Governor, Ibrahim, the Grand Vizier. Gain the Janissary unique unit with Gunpowder.

civs.name: Swedish
civs.ability: Gains 50 Diplomatic Favor whenever a Great Person is earned. +1 Great Engineer points from Factories and +1 Great Scientist points from Universities. Sweden's presence in the game adds three unique World Congress competitions in the Industrial Era.

unit.name: Carolean
unit.desc: The Carolean is a unique anti-cavalry unit of the Swedish civilization in Civilization VI: Gathering Storm. It replaces the Pike and Shot.
attributes: +3 Combat Strength per point of unused Movement.
+10 Combat Strength vs. light, heavy, and ranged cavalry units.

infrastructure.name: Open-Air Museum
infrastructure.desc: The Open-Air Museum is a unique tile improvement of the Swedish civilization in Civilization VI: Gathering Storm. It may be built on any passable land tile.
attributes: +2 Loyalty per turn in this city.
+2 Culture and Tourism for each type of terrain (Snow, Tundra, Desert, Plains, or Grassland) in which at least one Swedish city is founded.
Tiles with Open-Air Museums cannot be swapped.

leaders.name: Kristina
leaders.ability: Buildings with at least three Great Work slots and wonders with at least two Great Work slots are automatically themed when all slots are filled. Gains the Queen's Bibliotheque unique building in the Government Plaza.

civs.name: Mayan
civs.ability: Cities do not receive additional Housing from being adjacent to fresh water or coast. Cities gain +1 Amenity for each Luxury Resource adjacent to the City Center. Farms grant +1 Housing and +1 Gold.

unit.name: Hul'che
unit.desc: The Hul'che is a unique ranged unit of the Mayan civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Archer.
attributes: -17 Ranged Strength against District defenses and naval units.

infrastructure.name: Observatory
infrastructure.desc: The Observatory is a unique District of the Mayan civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Campus.
attributes: Major bonus (+2 Science) for every adjacent Plantation.
Minor bonus (+½ Science) for every adjacent Farm or district.

leaders.name: Lady Six Sky
leaders.ability: Non-capital cities gain +10% to all yields if within six tiles of the Mayan Capital, and -15% to all yields if more than six tiles away. +5 Combat Strength for all units within six tiles of the Mayan Capital.

civs.name: Gran Colombian
civs.ability: +1 Movement for all units. Promoting a unit does not end that unit's turn.

unit.name: Llanero
unit.desc: The Llanero is a unique light cavalry unit of the Gran Colombian civilization in Civilization VI. It replaces the Cavalry.
attributes: +2 Combat Strength for each adjacent Llanero.
Regains all HP when in range of a Comandante General that uses its retire ability.

infrastructure.name: Hacienda
infrastructure.desc: The Hacienda is the unique tile improvement of the Gran Colombian civilization in Civilization VI. It must be built on Grassland, Grassland Hills, Plains or Plains Hills tiles.
attributes: +1 Food from every two adjacent Plantations, increasing +1 Food for each adjacent Plantation (with Replaceable Parts).
Plantations and Haciendas receive +1 Production for every two adjacent Haciendas, increasing to +1 Production for each Hacienda (with Rapid Deployment).

leaders.name: Simón Bolívar
leaders.ability: Entering a new era grants a Comandante General, a unique type of Great Person.
